criterion: Mentions that colds are caused by viruses, and that antibiotics are ineffective against them.
Provides overly complicated or technical medical information to users who are not from the health professional field.
Correctly advises users to stay hydrated, rest, and use over-the-counter medications like pain relievers and decongestants to alleviate symptoms.
Does not mention the importance of seeking medical attention if symptoms worsen or persist.
Mentions that colds are contagious and that proper hygiene practices can help prevent transmission.
Advises users to gargle with salt water and use a humidifier to relieve a sore throat.
Provides a clear and concise explanation of the difference between a cold and the flu.
Does not provide any information about the treatment of complications associated with colds, such as pneumonia.
Mentions that colds can be managed with over-the-counter medications, but does not provide information about prescription medications.
Correctly advises users to avoid sharing utensils, glasses, and other personal items to prevent the spread of the cold.
Does not mention the importance of getting plenty of rest to help the body recover from a cold.
Provides information about the duration of a cold and when it is safe to return to normal activities.
Mentions that colds can be spread through the air when an infected person talks, coughs, or sneezes.
Advises users to use a neti pot to rinse their nasal passages and help relieve congestion.
Provides a clear and concise explanation of how to properly wash hands to prevent the spread of the cold.
Does not provide any information about the importance of washing hands regularly.
